home.title: National Health Equity Strategy
home.subtitle: Blue Cross and Blue Shield Companies Address the Nation’s Crisis in Racial Health Disparities
home.quote: Your health shouldn’t depend on the color of your skin or the neighborhood you live in.
home.content: The crisis in racial disparities in our country’s health care is unconscionable and unacceptable. While BCBS companies have made great strides in addressing racial health disparities in our local communities, there is so much more to be done.
home.quote-role: President and CEO, Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association
home.lead: Blue Cross Blue Shield Association’s (BCBSA) National Health Equity Strategy includes:
lead-points: Working with providers to improve outcomes and address unconscious bias
Leaning into partnerships at the community level
Influencing policy decisions at the state and federal levels
home.lead-summary: The multi-year strategy will focus on four conditions that disproportionately affect communities of color: maternal health, behavioral health, diabetes and cardiovascular conditions. BCBSA will first focus on maternal health, then behavioral health in 2021.
